properties.name: Ústav fyziky plazmatu AV ČR, v.v.i.
Institute of Physics AS CR
specialization: Research in elementary particle physics is carried out mostly within broad international collaboration. We participate in experiments at the large accelerators in CERN (Switzerland, France) and Fermilab (USA), where the deepest structure of matter and forces governing the microcosm are studied. Our activities in the development of particle detectors are closely connected.

The physics of condensed systems is focused on dynamical and cooperative phenomena in disordered and inhomogeneous materials, and in systems with reduced spatial dimensions. The main objects of interest are condensed materials exhibiting prominent physical properties, or subject to extreme conditions. We deal with preparation and research of functional materials, such as composites, superconductors, liquid crystals, and shape memory alloys, in the form of single crystals, polycrystals, nanostructured materials, thin films and coatings, combining theoretical, experimental and novel technological approaches.

The research in the domain of solid state physics is oriented towards new forms of solids, new physical phenomena and principles of microelectronic components. The properties of new materials are determined by their surface, defects, nanometric, layered or aperiodic structure. Characteristic is the interconnection of advanced technologies of preparation, unique methods of their characterisation in a broad range of external conditions, down to nanometric and atomic level, as well as processing of results with the aid of microphysical and ab-initio theoretical calculations. Great attention is paid to magnetic and optically active materials, nanocrystalline forms of silicon, III-V semiconductors, diamond and graphite, as well as to nanostructures for applications in medicine and microelectronics.

The preparation of new optical materials for optoelectronics is based on use of new plasma and hybrid techniques. The research in the field of quantum optics is focused on development of various types of sources of quantum-correlated photon pairs and on devices for transmission of underlying information.

In the field of High Power Photonics, IOP studies lasers and laser produced plasmas. The HiLASE laser centre (www.hilase.cz) is the spin-off of the terawatt iodine laser system PALS. HiLASE project focuses on the research and experimental development of novel high energy, pulsed diode-pumped solid state laser systems with high repetition rates and average output power on kW level. The HiLASE laser systems are significantly more powerful, compact, efficient and offer an easier maintenance than other available sources. Therefore, they have a great potential not only in basic science but also in applied research and high-tech industry, mostly in micro-machining technologies, testing resistance of optical materials, cutting, welding, removal of deposits and laser-shock peening.

ELI Beamlines is the Czech part of the distributed RI creating a new generation of secondary sources for interdisciplinary applications in physics, medicine, biology and material sciences._x000D_
ELI Beamlines is part of a European plan to build a new generation of large research facilities selected by the European Strategy Forum for Research Infrastructures (ESFRI). The main goal of ELI is to create one of the latest laser equipment in the world. There will be accomplished and implemented research projects covering the interaction of light with matter at intensity being many times higher than currently achievable values. ELI will provide ultra-short laser pulses of a few femtoseconds (10-15 fs) duration and give performance up to 10 PW. ELI will bring new techniques for medical image-display and diagnostics, radiotherapy, tools for new materials developing and testing, latest in X-ray optics, etc. ELI will also be an attractive platform for educating a new generation of scientists. More information about the ELI Beamlines project is available at www.eli-beams.eu

properties.name: TESLA Holding a.s.
specialization: The Transmitting Technologies Division is one of the oldest divisions of the company and has a long tradition. Currently it specializes in research, development and production of antenna units and construction of turnkey antenna systems. It also offers deliveries of transmitters for radio and television broadcasting including accessories entailing couplers, filters, rigid line components, feeders, etc. At the customer’s wishes the division safeguards all stages of projects applying to the construction of radio and television transmitting analogue and digital networks, beginning with the processing of planning documentation, delivery and assembly of transmitters and antenna systems, installation of surveillance centres, training of the operator and ending with the provision of a guarantee and post-guarantee service.

The Water Treatment Solutions Division successfully followed up on the delivery of stationary water treatment plants and extended its portfolio to transportable water treatment plants, filling lines and wastewater treatment plants. It offers complete deliveries and services while utilising the latest water treatment technologies from a draft solution right up to its implementation both at local and abroad. The division has its own development and realization departments engaged in the development, proposal, design, planning and delivery of the optimal solution for customers. The equipment is intended for the household, communal and industrial sector, crisis situations and it is also part of large investment projects. In its short period of activity, the division has become a major supplier of waterworks engineering, technological water treatment and wastewater treatment.

The Solar Technology division was established at the beginning of 2009 in response to the growing interest in solar technology on the market in the Czech Republic and other European countries. The division specialises in the broadest possible utilisation of solar systems for private and industrial purposes. It combines top know-how in the field of electrical equipment with the high-tech technologies of photovoltaic panels. This combination allows the division to design, deliver and construct an optimum solution with regard to capacity, price and quality for each potential customer of solar technology beginning with solar power plants and ending with photovoltaic systems. Thanks to the rich network of partners the division can offer the latest trends and technology in environmental friendly energy solution.

Military Telecommunications is the continuator and successor of the Microwave Equipment Division. Now it is our subsidiary company which is named TESLA, akciová společnost. In the period of its existence it gained a solid position in the field of special radio-communications as supplier of communications equipment for military stationary and mobile tactical networks. The main commodities are the production of radio-relay equipment for creating of microwave links, service works for security equipment and systems, light-current systems, structured networks and pick-up placing of printed circuits boards (PCB). The company also provides a complete service for all supplied technology. Currently equipment is mostly being developed for military use, but it is being considered to put this equipment to use in the civil/commercial sphere in future. Military Telecommunications is the general supplier of the communication part of the stationary telecommunications network of the Army of the Czech and Slovak Republic.

properties.name: QUINTA – ANALYTICA s.r.o.
specialization: Pharmaceutical analyses: Quinta provides a wide range of analytical services in the field of pharmaceutical analyses including analytical method development and validation, method transfer, quality control, release testing, stability studies. Quinta offers also analyses of highly potent substance/drugs, analytical support of formulation development, manufacturing process validation, analytical certificates. The analyses are conducted under GMP rules and ICH recommendation.

Biopharmaceutical analyses: Quinta offers services, which concern the comprehensive characterization of biological drugs of protein or peptide origin, including GMP validation of analytical methods, method transfer, quality control and release testing.

Clinical trials: Quinta provides complete service („turnkey contract“) or customized services in accordance to the sponsor’s requirements. Quinta also offers independent clinical, bioanalytical, pharmacokinetic and statistical evaluation. Quinta has own clinical centre fully equipped 36-beds with a high level of necessary care and comfort. Quinta offers various clinical trials like safety and tolerability, pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic studies, dose-ranging and linearity, drug-drug interaction, drug-food/alcohol interaction, bioavailability/bioequivalence, biodrug/biosimilars testing. Quinta has a team of experts with long-term experience in pharmacokinetic/bioequivalence studies of different design carried out on healthy volunteers (>2,500), special populations of healthy volunteers, as well as populations of subjects with special health conditions. Recruitment potential of special population includes elderly men and women (>65 years of age), postmenopausal women, diabetic patients, renal impairment patients (>600), psychiatric and neurological patients, overweight subjects, fast/slow metabolisers.

Bioanalyses:  Quinta offers development, validation of bioanalytical methods and analyses of pharmacologically active molecules and their metabolites in different biological matrices. Bioanalytical methods are developed and validated in accordance with GLP and ICH/FDA and EMEA guidelines. Quinta ensures also complex service of preclinical (toxicological) studies in cooperation with reliable external partner. The bioanalytical laboratories are equipped with 7 state-of-art LC/MS/MS instruments. So far Quinta has developed and validated more than 150 methods.

properties.name: Step TRUTNOV a.s.
specialization: A 100% Czech company operating in the local market for over 20 years, Step TRUTNOV has gathered a lot of experience during this period, becoming a leading manufacturer of biomass-fired boilers in the Czech Republic. The unique patented design of the Company enables burning whole bales of straw without pre-separation, which represents a significant competitive advantage over other manufacturers who must spend a large portion of electricity for crushing a straw bale before it is moved into the combustion chamber, i.e. combusted. Another advantage that this device represents are saved heating costs, which can move up to 5 times below those of gas. The Company alone has a boiler installed at its premises and compared with the original use of gas, when it paid 536 CZK per GJ, it moved to a mere of 78 CZK per GJ with the use of a boiler for burning whole bales of straw/hay.

The main changes Step TRUTNOV company went thru the last years were focused on boilers for biomass at the capacity of 100 and 190 kW. This new technology does not only produce heat energy, but also electricity energy. The aim of Step TRUTNOV Company was to be able to offer to their customer small independent “green island” with zero independency on external suppliers. This technology is environmentally friendly, complying with all emission limits and the low values of carbon dioxide as required by the law. But most importantly, the technology offers very low costs of heating and electricity, compare to other types of fuels and suppliers, available on the market. Step TRUTNOV company found a solution to use biomass waste, burn it in compliance with emission limits, produce heat and electricity and safe significant financial amount. Moreover, there is a planned funding from the EU for exactly this technology with at least 60% of eligible costs.

Polarization maintaining (PM) connectors assembly_x000D_
Fiber optic production technology for transmission and power splitting of linearly polarized optical signal. PM components production is performed in clean rooms according to the strictest industry standards, and product parameters meet the relevant IEC standards. properties.name: EKOL, spol. s r.o.
specialization: Research and development of low-emission burners for combustion chambers of gas turbines by the method of additional supply of air to the primary zone of the combustion chamber.
Research and development of low-emission burners for combustion chambers of gas turbines using a circular burner against successive rotating air flow (rotating local flow).

Research and development of hybrid burner with super low NOx and CO emissions. Hybrid burner has two circuits for fuel inlet, which are mutually independent to one another. The first circuit is used for diffused burning and is in operation at startup and at low performance; the second circuit is used for kinetic burning (burning of premixed fuel-air mixture) and is in operation of performance range of 50-100%. Reached emissions are in world-class technology in the field and they have a value of NOx <25 mgm-3, CO <20 mgm -3.
